reviews.text: Wonderful location at the sea/harbor with pool and own swimming location in front of the hotel. Was not to noisy. Of course you hear some music and traffic from the coastal road. Rooms and hotel is a little aged but okay. AC on level seven had to work hard against sun from rooftop and windows but great views!

Good location to get around the city with lots of restaurants around. Clean room with marina view and not loud at night. Hard to find room near the pool/sea area. Staff could improve on English, breakfast was repetitive, I would suggest a replacement of the lift as it was very hot and takes about a minute before the doors opened.

Read the reviews which were a bit off putting but went for it anyway, the lifts seem to be what most people complained about but we had no issues at all ! The breakfast was better than the excelsior which we had just moved from and was a lot more expensive & you can have your breakfast outside around the pool looking over Spinola bay. Definitely recommend

The room is clean and with a great view. The breakfast is very good with friendly chefs making any eggs you want. You have to be early to the pool to get a spot if you’re a friend group or a family. The air conditioning is central system, that means you don’t get it under 20°c inside your room. The gym is small, but if you are creative, you can get an ok workout.
Overall a good experience.

Room was great. The rest of the hotel felt like a budget package holiday. Pool area was dirty, food squashed into sun beds, breakfast - a good buffet breakfast but don’t ask for anything. It could do with some sound-isolation panels on the ceilings as it’s loud and echoes. Still a long way from a 4-star hotel. The location is great and the potential is there. Room cleaning staff were lovely. Reception/check in lacked a ‘welcome’ vibe. Maybe that’s how it is in Malta? I don’t think so though as everywhere else, service was warm and helpful.
